Transcription for 1222326

Can you give me some idea of what you think Jewish values are, or what you think is important to Jewish people?
Family. I would say family life is the absolute crux of it,
which then automatically makes one very loyal and community-minded.
And I would have said that that is really, in a sense, the success of the Jew in getting on in the world,
because he has the support of his family, who are willing to make sacrifices for him,
and he in turn is willing to make sacrifices for the greater community.
So there's a tremendous amount of inbuilt help, and that's really the essence of the success.
